results.name: In the binary Champernowne word A030190, shorten each run of consecutive identical bits by one bit.
comment: In other words, apply the transformation A318921 to the infinite word A030190.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..25000
example: then shorten each run by 1 bit (x indicates bits to be deleted):
and after deleting the x's we get the new sequence:
program: (PARI) p=-1; k=0; for (n=0, oo, my (b=if (n==0, [0], binary(n))); for (i=1, #b, if (p==b[i], print1 (p ", "); if (k++==87, break (2)), p=b[i]))) \\ _Rémy Sigrist_, Sep 09 2018
xref: A056062 shows lengths of runs before they are shortened.
